text: Is anyone else having issues where clicking on the module from the page is now opening links? I don't know if it is related to a release or update, but in the past, you could click anywhere on the module and it would open the content in the side bar, now if you have a module with a linked element it is opening the link in a new tab.
def a new thing for me too!

You can set some css to override it though.

Something like  `.hs-inline-edit a { pointer-events:none!important}` Should get you close to disabling them in the editor for the time being.
I couldn't implement that, I'm working on hundreds of pages across nearly a hundred portals
Ah, I thought I was just going crazy. :laughing:
haha, same, it's why I finally had to ask :zany_face:

That happens for me as well. I have magic css chrome extension and I was able to turn pointer events off like <@UQWGKUEN7> mentioned here. <@U03AKL6Q1B2> the magic css chrome extension persists across a domain

I also thought I was going crazy. I was ended up creating a button module to replace a button module in this theme because I thought it was bugged. Well later after I made a button and then it was bugged I went a bit crazy
